prompt: <description>**Part 1: Construct a large, round, white object with a small hole in the center.** Begin by creating a new coordinate system with the euler angles set to [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] and the translation vector set to [0.0, 0.0, 0.0]. For the sketch, create a new face (face\\_1) and add the following loops: - Loop 1: Draw a circle with a center at [0.375, 0.375] and a radius of 0.375. - Loop 2: Draw a circle with a center at [0.375, 0.375] and a radius of 0.2206. - Loop 3: Draw a circle with a center at [0.375, 0.7274] and a radius of 0.0132. For the extrusion, set the extrude depth towards the normal to 0.0441, the extrude depth opposite the normal to 0.0, the sketch scale to 0.75, and the operation to "New Body Feature". **Part 2: Construct a cylindrical object with a flat top and bottom, and a slightly tapered middle section.** Create a new coordinate system with the euler angles set to [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] and the translation vector set to [0.1544, 0.1544, 0.0]. For the sketch, create a new face (face\\_1) and add the following loop: - Loop 1: Draw a circle with a center at [0.2206, 0.2206] and a radius of 0.2206. For the extrusion, set the extrude depth towards the normal to 0.1765, the extrude depth opposite the normal to 0.0, the sketch scale to 0.4412, and the operation to "Join Feature". **Part 3: Construct a cylindrical object with a central hole, resembling a donut shape.** Create a new coordinate system with the euler angles set to [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] and the translation vector set to [0.0, 0.0, 0.0]. For the sketch, create a new face (face\\_1) and add the following loops: - Loop 1: Draw a circle with a center at [0.375, 0.375] and a radius of 0.375. - Loop 2: Draw a circle with a center at [0.375, 0.375] and a radius of 0.2206. - Loop 3: Draw a circle with a center at [0.375, 0.7274] and a radius of 0.0132. Please note that all measurements are provided in the given JSON, and should be used as-is in the CAD software. The "Join Feature" and "New Body Feature" operations refer to adding or creating new solid bodies, respectively, and do not require specific boolean operation terms.</description>

prompt: <description>Construct the Final Shape Part 1 Construct a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom, and a slightly tapered shape, with the narrowest point at the top. Begin by creating a new coordinate system: * Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] * Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] Next, create a 2D sketch on the X-Y plane of the new coordinate system with the following components: * Face 1 + Loop 1 - Line 1: Start Point [0.0, 0.0], End Point [0.75, 0.0] - Line 2: Start Point [0.75, 0.0], End Point [0.75, 0.4433] - Line 3: Start Point [0.75, 0.4433], End Point [0.0, 0.4433] - Line 4: Start Point [0.0, 0.4433], End Point [0.0, 0.0] Now, scale the sketch by 0.75. Then, transform the 2D sketch into 3D using the following parameters: * Euler Angles (same as the coordinate system) * Translation Vector (same as the coordinate system) Lastly, extrude the sketch to create the 3D model with the following parameters: * Extrusion Depth Towards Normal: 0.0 * Extrusion Depth Opposite Normal: 0.0269 * Sketch Scale: 0.75 The final shape of Part 1 should be a rectangular prism with dimensions 0.75 x 0.0269 x 0.75 units. Part 2 Construct a rectangular prism that intersects with Part 1. The front face of the prism will be angled at 45 degrees. To accomplish this, create a new coordinate system with the following parameters: * Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] * Translation Vector: [0.0217, 0.0, 0.0252] Next, create a 2D sketch on the X-Y plane of the new coordinate system with the following components: * Face 1 + Loop 1 - Line 1: Start Point [0.0, 0.0], End Point [0.7059, 0.0] - Line 2: Start Point [0.7059, 0.0], End Point [0.7059, 0.3971] - Line 3: Start Point [0.7059, 0.3971], End Point [0.0, 0.3971] - Line 4: Start Point [0.0, 0.3971], End Point [0.0, 0.0] Now, scale the sketch by 0.7059. Then, transform the 2D sketch into 3D using the same parameters as the coordinate system. Lastly, extrude the sketch to create the 3D model with the following parameters: * Extrusion Depth Towards Normal: 0.0 * Extrusion Depth Opposite Normal: 0.0074 * Sketch Scale: 0.7059 Part 2 will intersect with Part 1 along the angled face. Part 3 Construct a rectangular prism that joins with the remaining Part 1. To accomplish this, create a new coordinate system with the following parameters: * Euler Angles: [180.0, 0.0, -90.0] * Translation Vector: [0.7311, 0.0269, 0.1345] Next, create a 2D sketch on the X-Y plane of the new coordinate system with the following components: * Face 1 + Loop 1 - Line 1: Start Point [0.0, 0.0], End Point [0.7122, 0.0] - Line 2: Start Point [0.7122, 0.0], End Point [0.7122, 0.208] - Line 3: Start Point</description>
